children.text: A full service law firm based in New York City, we deliver top-notch services at reasonable prices to businesses and individuals.

We maintain the highest level of ethical standards, and strive to keep the channels of communication open to our clients. While the law can be complex and convoluted, it is our job to walk you through any legal processes such that they are comprehensible and stress-free.

Ms. Zheng brings to you a combined six years of experiences in litigation, immigration, business and family law. She is trial lawyer particularly experienced in employment litigation, deportation defense, as well as criminal and family matters. With the breadth and depth of her practices, Ms. Zheng brings to her clients well-rounded services and in-depth knowledge of the legal industry.

Indeed, the law is not just the words in the books; it is a way to bringing practical solutions to businesses and individuals in a cost-effective manner. With her commitment to excellence, ethics and grace, Ms. Zheng strives to be a different kind of lawyer who offers the best communication, the most honest and meticulously researched legal advice, as well as a sophisticated, goal-oriented legal strategy - all stemming from her genuine care for her clients.

Ms. Zheng obtained her Juris Doctor degree from The George Washington University Law School and is a member of the New York Bar. She is fluent in English and Mandarin Chinese, and speaks conversational German.
New York Supreme Court, Appellate Division, Third Department
United States District Court, Souther District of New York
United States District Court, Eastern District of New York
United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit

“No one can feel free from danger and destruction until the many torn threads of civilization are bound together again. We cannot feel safer until every nation, regardless of weapons or power, will meet together in good faith, the people worthy of mutual association.”

Ruth Bader Ginsburg (The Notorious RBG)

There are two most complex areas of law in the United States: the tax code and immigration law. However, people tend to associate the practice of immigration law with filling out forms and operating a papermill. This should not give you the false impression that you do not need an immigration lawyer to do just that, because people stumble into the very pitfalls that they don't know exist.

We are located in an immigrant-built city and serve a community who proudly calls themselves immigrants. Let our years of experience with ICE officers, Immigration Judges, and USCIS officers be on your side to each milestone en route to realizing your American Dream.

“Each of us is more than the worst thing we’ve ever done.”
Bryan Stevenson, Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption

Everybody deserves a second chance, even the ones who cannot pay their lawyers. This is why our system affords virtually everyone a free lawyer when facing criminal charges. Contrary to popular belief, most public defenders are even more experienced than private practitioners and they can and will push for the best result for you.

What distinguishes our criminal practice is that we strikes a balance between bringing our clients swiftly results (hence less legal fees!) and the practical implications of plea deals: We care about how it impacts your immigration status, work eligibility, and child custody, and endeavors to obtain what is best for you.

We have all been employed and we know what it's like with bosses. They hold the key to our livelihood and many fail to carry such great responsibility. Capitalism is eclipsing at the bond people used to develop with their masters and their servants.
We are equipped with years of expertise with these age-old conflicts and are here to help you resolve some of the most feared lawsuits by American employers.
Please let us know any questions and comments you may have by filling out the form below. Thank you and we look forward to working with you.
